quiz.questionText: What kind of devices can run Augmented Reality experiences?

answerOptions.answerText: Only smartphones and tablets.
Smartphones, tablets, smart glasses, computers, headsets and more.
Only headsets.

quiz.questionText: Which of the following is a requirement for a GPS based application?

answerOptions.answerText: Access to the device's global positioning system tools.
A map application must be installed.
A marker is required to display virtual objects.

quiz.questionText: Which of the following is a use case for XR?

answerOptions.answerText: Training and Development
Productivity and Collaboration
Design and Prototyping
All the above

quiz.questionText: XR devices are only available as a headset.

answerOptions.answerText: True
False

quiz.questionText: What is Haptic Technology?

answerOptions.answerText: Any technology that can create an experience of touch by applying forces, vibrations or motions to the user.
Any technology that allows the user to see 3D models.
Any technology that allows the user to be immersed in an application.

quiz.questionText: Which is a benefit of a tethered device?

answerOptions.answerText: Tethered devices provide better computing power regardless of the device its connected to.
The cable connection helps reduce latency between what you do physically and movement in the virtual world.
Tethered devices enable you to wirelessly experience apps.

quizzes.title: Lesson 3: Choosing a Device and Reality

quiz.questionText: In the scenario of a fully immersive solution, which reality is a better choice?

answerOptions.answerText: Either Augmented or Virtual Reality
Virtual Reality
Augmented Reality

quiz.questionText: In the scenario of an app that overlays digital artwork on top of a mural in your physical environment, which reality is a better choice?

answerOptions.answerText: Either Augmented or Virtual Reality
Virtual Reality
Augmented Reality

quiz.questionText: In the scenario of an app that has multi-user support, which reality is a better choice?

answerOptions.answerText: Either Augmented or Virtual Reality
Virtual Reality
Augmented Reality

quiz.questionText: Which of the following statements best defines the relationship between vergence and accommodation?

answerOptions.answerText: Vergence allows our eyes to send information to the brain while accommodation helps us understand it.
Vergence is the movement done by eyes to avoid seeing double images, while accommodation is the process by which we maintain a clear image or focus.
Vergence allows our eyes to focus on a distant object, while accommodation allows our eyes to focus on a closer object.

quiz.questionText: What should an application avoid to reduce fatigue, eye and neck strain?

answerOptions.answerText: Angles more than 10 degrees above the horizon, 60 degrees below the horizon and neck rotations more than 45 degrees off center.
Excessive jumping performed by the user.
Setting the user's resting gaze 10 to 20 degrees below the horizon.

quiz.questionText: Which of the following limitations must be accounted for to ensure user comfort?

answerOptions.answerText: The file size of an application.
The number of external connections to peripherals such as controllers and monitors.
The desired range of movement, which actions require physical movement, the user gaze's angle, and arm positions.

quiz.questionText: Why are coordinate systems used?

answerOptions.answerText: To calculate the variables of an equation.
To add physics to a 3D object.
To express the geometry of a space, as well as determining an object's position and orientation.

quiz.questionText: Which of the following is true?

answerOptions.answerText: The orientation of a coordinate system can change depending on the development environment.
Coordinate systems are always the same.
Coordinate systems are not commonly used in XR development.

quiz.questionText: Anchors allow for objects to stay in place as they are designated points within the spectrum of the real world, rather than inside the application's coordinate system.

answerOptions.answerText: True
False

quiz.questionText: Why are physics important in XR development?

answerOptions.answerText: So that planet-based applications can have gravity.
By enabling objects to be controlled and manipulated similarly to objects in the real world, physics allows for experiences that are as close to reality as possible.
Physics enables developers to create XR experiences without code.

quiz.questionText: Which of the following best describes a force?

answerOptions.answerText: An interaction that modifies or changes the motion of an object.
The strength developed by a fitness trainer.
A mystical power that encompasses all living beings, be it from the light or the dark side.

quiz.questionText: How are forces applied in XR?

answerOptions.answerText: Through telepathy.
By adding two coordinate planes together to calculate an output.
Through environment changes, user's input, conditions.

quiz.questionText: What is the goal of Bodystorming?

answerOptions.answerText: To act as an ice-breaker for members of a development team.
To generate and evaluate ideas for XR experiences, beyond the traditional idea of 2D development.
To fully design applications using real-world objects.

quiz.questionText: What is the main focus of the process of acting?

answerOptions.answerText: Experiencing the user's perspective.
Making friends.
To test out advanced functionalities in a safe environment.

quiz.questionText: If there is a need to convey the aesthetic look and feel of an application, what kind of storyboard should be used?

answerOptions.answerText: A previously approved storyboard.
A low fidelity storyboard.
A high fidelity storyboard.

quiz.questionText: Are prototypes expected to be fully fledged applications?

answerOptions.answerText: No, they are expected to be simple designs.
No, but they should parallel how the users expect to interact with the app.
Yes, and should only include complete objects and no placeholders whatsoever.

quiz.questionText: What does Spatial Mapping encompass?

answerOptions.answerText: Creating a map of space, including planets and their moons.
Creating models of 3D objects.
Creating a 3D map of the real-world environment, often through a continuously updating mesh

quiz.questionText: Which of the following are all use cases for spatial awareness?

answerOptions.answerText: Teleportation, creating buttons, and interacting with controllers
Occlusion, seeing invisible objects, and voice command
Placement, occlusion, physics and navigation

quiz.questionText: How does audio improve an immersive experience?

answerOptions.answerText: Audio serves no purpose in an immersive experience.
Audio provides the user with the ability to see 3D objects as a wire-frame.
Audio can mimic sounds that the user would expect to hear in a physical environment.

quiz.questionText: What are the three modalities for the hands and motion controllers input model?

answerOptions.answerText: There is only one modality, motion controllers.
Motion controllers, static controllers and handheld controllers.
Direct manipulation with hands, point and commit with hands and motion controllers.

quiz.questionText: In the scenario in which the user needs to manipulate a distant object, which modality would do best?

answerOptions.answerText: Point and Commit with hands
Motion controllers
Direct manipulation with hands

quiz.questionText: If an object is surrounded by markers or handles for your hands to interact with, you can assume you are experiencing

answerOptions.answerText: A non-affordance-based manipulation..
A point and commit manipulation.
An affordance-based manipulation.

quiz.questionText: A Hands Free model is best for apps that require a user to use one or two hands to interact with their real-world environment?

answerOptions.answerText: True
False

quiz.questionText: Which is a benefit of the Hands Free model?

answerOptions.answerText: Allows developers to ignore prototyping an app before development.
Prevents hand fatigue.
A user can interact with both hands.

quiz.questionText: When should the Gaze and Dwell modalities be used?

answerOptions.answerText: When developing apps for devices that can't track the user's eyes or head movements.
In situations where audio is a viable alternative and the user has freedom to use their hands.
In scenarios where voice isn't ideal or possible, and the user might be using their hands for a different task.

quiz.questionText: What is the difference between the Gaze and Commit and Gaze and Dwell modalities?

answerOptions.answerText: Gaze and Dwell only works in Augmented Reality.
The Gaze and Commit modality requires a secondary input, while Gaze and Dwell only requires one.
Gaze and Commit only works on mobile devices.

quiz.questionText: What is a good practice to notify users when they are accurately targeting an element?

answerOptions.answerText: Adding cues, such as hover effects, audio highlights or clicks, or clear alignment of a cursor with the element.
Transitioning to a different scene or stage once the element is targeted.
Sending an email or text message to the user once the element has been targeted.

quiz.questionText: Head and eye tracking is available in all XR devices.

answerOptions.answerText: True
False
